title: Easeout Weekly #10
body:
![Dark mode letters](/images/uploads/dark-light-text-backgrounds.png) [Dark mode and variable fonts](https://css-tricks.com/dark-mode-and-variable-fonts/) Robin Rendle writes about how we can fix the "white text on dark background" problem by making the text thinner in dark mode using variable fonts! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/dark-mode-and-variable-fonts/)
![98.css Landing Page](/images/uploads/98-css.png) [98.css](https://jdan.github.io/98.css/) 98.css is a CSS library for building interfaces that look like Windows 98. [See it ➡️](https://jdan.github.io/98.css/)
![Flutter Logo](/images/uploads/flutter-sharing-image-large.png) [Responsive Web And Desktop Development With Flutter](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/responsive-web-desktop-development-flutter/) Here’s what you need to know to be ready to take on the task of developing web and desktop apps using this wonderful cross-platform framework. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/responsive-web-desktop-development-flutter/)
![Agile method diagram](/images/uploads/collaborative-coding-ultimate-career-hack.png) [Why Collaborative Coding Is The Ultimate Career Hack](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/collaborative-coding-ultimate-career-hack/) Whatever stage you’re at in your career, coding collaboratively is one of the best uses of your time. And there’s never been a better time to practice pair programming and embrace Agile development. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/collaborative-coding-ultimate-career-hack/)
![Favicon Examples](/images/uploads/svg-favicons.png) [SVG, Favicons, and All the Fun Things We Can Do With Them](https://css-tricks.com/svg-favicons-and-all-the-fun-things-we-can-do-with-them/) A neat article on using an SVG as a favicon. It’s something that most modern browsers are now supporting. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/svg-favicons-and-all-the-fun-things-we-can-do-with-them/)
![Responsive Social Platform UI Landing](/images/uploads/social-ui.png) [Responsive Social Platform UI](https://codepen.io/TurkAysenur/full/RwWKYMO) Aysenur Turk codes a fully responsive social UI from [this beautiful](https://dribbble.com/shots/5581599-027-100-Daily-UI-Intranet-Employee-Profile) dribbble shot by Quan Ha. [Read it ➡️](https://codepen.io/TurkAysenur/full/RwWKYMO)
![Customisable Netflix Logo](/images/uploads/netflix-logo-custom.png) [Customisable Netflix Logo Animation](https://codepen.io/chigggs/pen/VwvLZRY) A fun Netflix logo animation with color switch options. [Check it out ➡️](https://codepen.io/chigggs/pen/VwvLZRY)
![Serverless App Flows](/images/uploads/twitter-serverless.png) [Rethinking Twitter as a Serverless App](https://css-tricks.com/rethinking-twitter-as-a-serverless-app/) This article shows we can build a real-world app with highly dynamic data in a serverless fashion using React hooks, FaunaDB & Cloudinary. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/rethinking-twitter-as-a-serverless-app/)
![Terminal screen with Node commands](/images/uploads/nodejs-internals-multiple-file-creation.png) [Exploring Node.js Internals](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/nodejs-internals/) This article walks us through Node.js, with a focus on understanding how its internals interact with one another. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/nodejs-internals/)
![Brotli Article Introduction](/images/uploads/brotli.png) [Real-World Effectiveness of Brotli](https://csswizardry.com/2020/04/real-world-effectiveness-of-brotli/) This article provides a wonderfully detailed comparison of gzip vs brotli for asset compression. [Read it ➡️](https://csswizardry.com/2020/04/real-world-effectiveness-of-brotli/)
![Search Logo with Tartanify](/images/uploads/add-lunr-to-gatsby.png) [How to Add Lunr Search to your Gatsby Website](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-add-lunr-search-to-your-gatsby-website/) A great tutorial showing how we can add search functionality to our JAMStack websites with lunr & Gatsby.js. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-add-lunr-search-to-your-gatsby-website/)
![BEM Page Diagram](/images/uploads/website-sketch.jpg) [Building a Scalable CSS Architecture With BEM and Utility Classes](https://css-tricks.com/building-a-scalable-css-architecture-with-bem-and-utility-classes/) This article explains how we can build a scalable architecture for our projects using CSS globals, BEM & utility classes. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/building-a-scalable-css-architecture-with-bem-and-utility-classes/)
![Wash you hands text](/images/uploads/text-shadow-depth-effect.png) [Creating Playful Effects With CSS Text Shadows](https://css-tricks.com/creating-playful-effects-with-css-text-shadows/) A fun demonstration of how we can use the CSS text-shadow property to create truly 3D-looking text. [Check it out ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/creating-playful-effects-with-css-text-shadows/)
![Stripe & Streaming with Suz Hinton](/images/uploads/shoptalk-suz-hinton.png) [Stripe & Streaming with Suz Hinton](https://shoptalkshow.com/409/) A talk with Suz Hinton about what it's like to work at Stripe, how businesses should consider storing billing data, her live stream coding journey, and building and coding digital devices like the Arduino. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/409/)
![React Setup Page](/images/uploads/skeleton-screens-react.png) [Implementing Skeleton Screens In React](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/skeleton-screens-react/) This tutorial looks at what a skeleton screen UI is and some types of skeleton screen libraries, along with their pros and cons. Then at how to build a YouTube-like skeleton screen UI using React loading skeleton. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/skeleton-screens-react/)
## Previous Issue: * [Easeout Weekly #9](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-04-18-easeout-weekly-9)
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
